On Fri, Oct 15, 2010 at 12:37 PM, izuzak <izuzak@...> wrote:
> A p2p =
REST style, and consequently a p2p Web, is definitely not rambling -- what =
it *is* is the focus of my ph.d. research :). Having a p2p network on the H=
TTP level would not only solve a lot of existing communication problems of =
the Web, but also increase the number application-level functionalities exp=
osed on the Web. Think of all the functionalities that are "trapped" on the=
 client side, disconnected from the Web, although they originated from the =
Web by the means of navigating to a Web application.
>

Is that the same as=
, or different than, the various attempts to put a
server in your browser, =
like the deceased KnowNow or the apparently
still-living Opera Unite?
